definition: to give up completely or leave behind
example: Facing unexpected turbulence, the pilot refused to abandon the passengers' hope.

definition: to officially end a practice or system
example: Educational reforms aim to abolish unfair admission quotas.

Vocabulary drills accelerate recognition during TOEFL listening sections.

definition: a total formed by combining several elements
example: The report showed an aggregate improvement across all mock tests.

definition: to make a problem less severe
example: Regular review alleviates test anxiety.
The ambiguous thesis confused the graders.

The example sentences appeal to Chinese learners by referencing familiar contexts.
Only academic idioms applicable to TOEFL topics should be prioritized.

Avoid arbitrary word lists; follow themed decks instead.

Use authentic TOEFL sources to craft practice passages.

Her coherent essay impressed the instructor.

definition: to happen at the same time
example: Mock exams coincide with the final review sprint.
Peers collaborate on speaking drills using shared scripts.
Daily commitment builds long-term vocabulary retention.

definition: able to exist together without conflict
example: The spaced repetition schedule stays compatible with school classes.
Listening practice complements daily word reviews.
We released a comprehensive word pack with CN hints.
Teachers confer badges to learners who master each deck.

Customs may detain travelers to inspect documents.
The class will devise mnemonic stories for confusing verbs.

definition: to spread over a wide area
example: Push notifications disperse reviews throughout the day.
